entry.title: GLIDE MAN JAILED FOLLOWING ALLEGED ASSAULT INCIDENT
entry.summary: December 28, 2025 3:00 p.m. A Glide man was jailed following an alleged assault incident on Saturday morning. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 7:20 a.m. deputies responded to a home in the 300 block of French Creek Road in the Glide area. 40-year-old Daniel Cox was found hiding in the residence and...

entry.title: CALIFORNIA MAN JAILED FOR RESTRAINING ORDER/DRUG LAW VIOLATIONS
entry.summary: December 28, 2025 2:50 p.m. A California man was jailed for restraining order and drug law violations early Sunday. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 2:15 a.m. a vehicle was called in with two subjects acting suspicious acting suspicious in the 500 block of Fifth Street in Canyonville. The two were reported to...

entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY 4:00 P.M. SUNDAY TO 4:00 P.M. wEDNESDAY
entry.summary: December 28, 2025 2:30 p.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory is in effect from 4:00 p.m. Sunday through 4:00 p.m. Wednesday for central Douglas County and its eastern foothills, along with much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said poor air quality will develop Sunday evening and continue through Wednesday. This...

entry.title: WARMING CENTER TO ACTIVATE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 27, 2025 10:30 a.m . The United Community Action Network will open the Roseburg Warming Center on Sunday night in response to temperatures dropping within activation thresholds. Check-in and a meal will be offered from 5:30 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. in the St. Joseph’s Catholic Church gymnasium at 630 West Stanton Street. Monday morning...

A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said just after 8:15 a.m. the 42-year-old was called in for being disorderly in the 200 block of Grant Smith Road in the Green District. The suspect was located on neighboring property...

entry.title: ROSEBURG MAN JAILED FOR WARRANT ON THURSDAY

entry.title: TRANSIENT JAILED FOLLOWING TRESPASS, DISORDERLY CONDUCT INCIDENT

A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 11:30 a.m. 42-year-old Andrew Atterbury was called in after he allegedly refused to leave a business in the 4700 block of Northeast Stephens Street. When a deputy...

entry.title: Roseburg Warming Center Activated Saturday Night as Cold Weather Continues
entry.summary: The Roseburg Warming Center will be open Saturday night, Dec. 27, at St. Joseph’s Gymnasium. Check-in begins at 5:30 p.m. with overnight shelter, meals, and limited pet accommodations available.

entry.title: ROSEBURG WARMING CENTER TO BE ACTIVATED SATURDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: December 26, 2025 10:15 a.m. The United Community Action Network will open the Roseburg Warming Center for Saturday night in response to temperatures that are expected to drop with activation thresholds. The center will open at 5:30 p.m. at the St. Joseph’s Catholic Church gymnasium, located at 630 West Stanton Street. Warm meals, shelter, and...

entry.title: SUTHERLIN POLICE JAIL MAN AFTER WITNESSING TRAFFIC VIOLATIONS
entry.summary: December 26, 2025 10:00 a.m. Sutherlin Police jailed a man after witnessing several traffic violations on Tuesday afternoon. An SPD report released on Friday said at 12:10 p.m. 51-year-old Michael Dowell was contacted in the 1600 block of West Central Avenue after a short pursuit. An officer recognized the man as having a parole warrant...

entry.title: The Sun Sets on Purelight Power: Medford Headquarters Shutter as Federal Solar Credits Vanish
entry.summary: The Christmas season brought a deep chill to Southern Oregon’s renewable energy sector this week as Purelight Power, the Medford-based residential solar giant, announced the immediate cessation of all operations. The company, which had grown into one of the largest installers in the region, is moving toward a total liquidation under Chapter 7 bankruptcy, citing… The post The Sun Sets on Purelight Power: Medford Headquarters Shutter as Federal Solar Credits Vanish appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.summary: December 26, 2025 9:30 a.m. One driver was taken to the hospital and was cited, following a single vehicle wreck on Interstate 5 northbound on Thursday afternoon. An Oregon State Police report said at 2:00 p.m. the driver of a large SUV was attempting to enter the freeway from the Curtin/Lorane onramp when the vehicle...

entry.title: LOCAL REAL ESTATE TODAY 12.26.25
entry.summary: Mary Gilbert of the Mary Gilbert Group, Powered by PLACE at Keller Williams Southern Oregon has our weekly local look at real estate.

entry.title: Tubing Canceled This Weekend at Diamond Lake Resort Due to Low Snow Levels
entry.summary: Tubing at Diamond Lake Resort is canceled this weekend due to low snow levels. Only about 5 inches of snow has fallen, and at least 2 feet is needed for safe tubing. Visitors may still bring their own sleds and enjoy the snow for free.

entry.title: RFP awarded $150k in lawsuit
entry.summary: Roseburg Forest Products (RFP) is trying to collect nearly $150,000 a judge deemed the company is owed from a Portland-area lighting company that reportedly forged documents and took funds it was not entitled to.

entry.title: Judge allows ODFW to order WWCD to fix Winchester Dam fish ladder by 2028
entry.summary: The Winchester Water Control District (WWCD) was told to start work next week on improving the fish passage in the Winchester Dam to be consistent with current standards, but an appeal might change all that.

entry.title: WYDEN, COLLEAGUES DEMAND PAUSE ON CHANGE IN NATIONAL PARK ENTRY FEES
entry.summary: December 26, 2025 7:20 a.m. On Wednesday, Oregon Senator Ron Wyden said he has joined colleagues in calling on the Trump administration to pause its new national park entry fees and annual passes fees for non-residents, scheduled to take effect on January 1st. A release said Wyden and the other senators said the new fees...

entry.summary: December 26, 2025 6:45 a.m. A driver was taken to the hospital following an overnight wreck on Wednesday. entry.title: WET ROADWAY LEADS TO ROLLOVER CRASH ON WEDNESDAY MORNING
entry.summary: December 26, 2025 6:30 a.m. A wet roadway led to a rollover crash on Interstate 5 northbound early Wednesday morning. A report from the Oregon State Police said at 3:45 a.m. troopers were called out to the wreck near the Edenbower Boulevard Exit 126. A minivan was northbound in the left lane of travel when...

entry.title: LINGERING SHOWERS THROUGH FRIDAY, HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING SATURDAY
entry.summary: December 26, 2025 6:15 a.m. The Umpqua Valley will have lingering showers on Friday before high pressure begins building in the region on Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that a high-pressure system will remain in place through Wednesday bringing dry conditions with high...

entry.title: Roseburg Schools invites residents to join facilities advisory committee
entry.summary: Roseburg Schools, formerly Roseburg Public Schools, is forming a new Community Facilities Advisory Committee. Local residents are welcome to apply.

entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 P.M. FRIDAY IN MOUNTAIN AREAS
entry.summary: December 26, 2025 5:45 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect until 10:00 p.m. Friday for mountain areas in parts of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said snow is expected for elevations above 4,500 feet in the Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains. Additional accumulations of 3 to 9 inches are...

entry.title: Free Christmas tree recycling offered Dec. 29-Jan. 12
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Starting Monday, Roseburg Disposal Co. will continue its annual tradition of offering free Christmas tree recycling.
